IX.iii.1.J.6.f
.
Dual-Use of Property
In some instances, a claimant’s place of residence and place of business are the same.
Example
:  A farmer may live in a house on the farm or a grocer may live in an apartment over the store.
Result
:  In such cases, the value of the residence area must be considered separately from the value of the business area.  The value of the residence area may be excluded.  The value of the business area is considered an asset the same as any other business asset.
If the claimant lives on a farm which is not used for business purposes, exclude the value of the residence area and consider the rest of the farm as an asset.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section J - Net Worth, Asset Transfers, and Penalty Periods
